getPlainText

public static java.lang.String getPlainText(org.w3c.dom.Document htmlDoc)
Get content of HTML document as plain text.

Alignment, color, fonts and that kind of things are ignored so text is displayed unformatted.

Moreover images, scripts, forms, input fields and other things are ignored.

Unordered and ordered lists are supported... however type attribute is ignored so items from unordered lists are always written with a preceding * and items from ordered lists with their corresponding number followed by .

Tables are supported but only if they are not nested and in any case rowspan/colspan attributes are ignored and borders are not displayed.

<pre> and <xmp> tag are also supported...

<pre> will ignore tags and unescape escaped characters.

<xmp> write all (even html tags with their attributes although output can be slightly different from input due to html parsing) and won't unescape anything.

IMPORTANT: If you want to display a plain text with a navigator you must include it whithin <pre>...</pre> (if there are no tags nor escaped characters) or <xmp>...</xmp> for correct display.

Parameters:
htmlDoc - Document (expected to be an HTML document read with JTidy)
Returns:
Content of HTML document as plain text

getPlainTextFromNode

private static java.lang.String getPlainTextFromNode(org.w3c.dom.Node parent,
                                                     int tabLevel,
                                                     boolean allowTable)
Get content from a node of an HTML document as plain text.

Parameters:
parent - Node from wich get content as plain text
tabLevel - Level of indentation
allowTable - Flag to indicate if it is allowed to display tables (used to ignore nested tables)
Returns:
Content from a node of an HTML document as plain text

importNode

private static org.w3c.dom.Node importNode(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
                                           org.w3c.dom.Node importNode)
Get an imported node from a node of another document.

Note that this method imports recursively all child nodes under the node to import.

However be careful that this method only import element nodes (with their attributes) and text nodes.

Parameters:
doc - Document to import to
importNode - Node to import from
Returns:
Imported node from a node of another document

breakText

public static java.lang.String breakText(java.lang.String text)
Parameters:
text - Text
Returns:
Same text but replacing '\n' characters with <br/> tags after escaping it using HTML entities

breakText

public static java.lang.String breakText(java.lang.String text,
                                         int maxBreaks)
Parameters:
text - Text
maxBreaks - Maximum number of breaks allowed or 0 unlimited
Returns:
Same text but replacing '\n' characters with <br/> tags after escaping it using HTML entities

breakText

public static java.lang.String breakText(java.lang.String text,
                                         int maxBreaks,
                                         boolean escape)
Parameters:
text - Text
maxBreaks - Maximum number of breaks allowed or 0 unlimited
escape - Flag to indicate if characters within text must be escaped using HTML entities (true) or not (false).
Returns:
Same text but replacing '\n' characters with <br/> tags after escaping it using HTML entities (optional)
